page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This S.E.corner of Leicestershire is in the Welland Valley.It is mainly agricultural with good arable and pasture land.The other main feature is the Eyebrook Reservoir which covers approximately a quarter of the total area of this block.It was once used mainly for industrial purposes,but is now mostly recreational fishing. The two villages,STOKE DRY and part of LYDDINGTON are small communities away from the main A6003,the Oakham to Kettering road which is the only main road passing through the area.The entire population in this block is under 500. The highest point in this area is 105m above sea level,the rest of the land is undulating or flat.In the extreme S.E. corner there is part of a dismantled railway.
